authors.author: Katherine Lee Bates Samuel A. Ward

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O beautiful for spacious skies, newline For amber waves of grain, newline For purple mountains majesties newline Above the fruited plain! newline America! America! newline God shed His grace on thee, newline And crown thy good with brotherhood newline From sea to shining sea!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: O beautiful for pilgrim feet, newline Whose stern, impassioned stress newline A thoroughfare for freedom beat newline Across the wilderness! newline America! America! newline God mend thine ev'ry flaw. newline Confirm thy soul in self control, newline Thy liberty in law!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: O beautiful for heroes proved newline In liberating strife, newline Who more than self their country loved, newline And mercy more than life! newline America! America! newline May God thy gold refine newline Till all success be nobleness newline And every gain divine!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: O beautiful for patriot dream newline That sees beyond the years newline Thine alabaster cities gleam, newline Undimmed by human tears! newline America! America! newline God shed His grace on thee, newline And crown thy good with brotherhood newline From sea to shining sea.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: O beautiful for men of faith newline Who founded this great land; newline Proclaimed for us, "In God we trust," newline And held to God's strong hand. newline America! America! newline God shed His grace on thee newline Till lives confess His righteousness newline From sea to shining sea.
